root.para: JLM’s fixed-rate bond obligation together with the interest rate swap it entered into is economically equal to a variable-rate obligation as a result of entering into the interest rate swap. For example, interest expense for the quarter ended June 30, 20X1, was $21,250, consisting of $20,000 paid under the bond plus $1,250 paid under the swap. This equals interest on the bond at the variable rate of 8.5% ($1,000,000 × 8.5% × 3/12 = $21,250). Due to the fact that the benchmark interest rate increased during the first 5 months of the hedging relationship, the fair value of the interest rate swap decreased, resulting in JLM making net interest cash payments on the settlement dates.
